reviews.text: My new company put me up here the night before my interview with them. I travelled from Chicago and was exhausted when I arrived. Check in was quick so I was up to my room and in the comfortable bed within minutes of arrival. The bed was just what I needed after 6 hours of travel. In the morning I ordered room service which was probably the best room service meal I've had (and I order a lot of room service breakfast). The bathroom was spacious and the shower was strong.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here at the end of a four week trip around California for our honeymoon. Our room was lovely, very clean and very quiet. The hotel is positioned well within the city.
reviews.title: Amazing service
Wonderful! Stay Here For Business or Pleasure!
reviews.text: We had had our credit card cloned earlier in our trip. Our credit card company had wired us the money which ended up being extremely complicated and stressful. In frustration, we asked at reception if they could help us as we had really hit a brick wall. Blaine was working the front desk. She spent about an hour with us making phone calls and looking up information for us on the Internet. I cannot stress how amazing Blaine was and really helped to calm us down. Although the issue was not resolved simply, she really went out of her way and was really rather determined to solve this issue for us. We were utterly stunned that someone would spend so much time and effort to help a couple of strangers. Nothing was too much effort for her.
I do hope her manager reads this and passes on our thanks. You should give this lady a pay rise and a promotion. What an absolute asset to your hotel. Keep hold of her! Thanks Blaine!
reviews.title: Great location and great property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My coworkers and I were traveling to Sac on a business trip and were tired of the chain hotel down the street, so I looked at the nearby options and found this beauty! The building was built in 1924 and has lots of great Art Deco touches! Our check in with a credit card authorization beforehand from work was quick and seamless, and we all received our requested upper floor rooms. The rooms were very clean with great beds and wonderful city views. The bathrooms were large and well stocked with nice bath soaps, shampoos, etc. A Keurig coffee maker made making some outstanding coffee in the morning a breeze. The workout room was well equipped and I was the only person utilizing it both mornings. What was also fun was the nice staircase that spanned the entire 14 floors- a most excellent stairmaster! All the staff was very nice and went beyond the norm to make sure our stay was fun and comfortable. With the convention center and the state capitol two blocks away, I have found my go-to hotel for Sacramento! I can't wait to take my husband for a non work trip!
reviews.title: Quality Hotel, good Downtown location
room was ok, the grange restaurant was delish!!!
reviews.text: the room looked good, but at the same time appeared to be kind of cheaply adorned - "expensive looking but not really". the toiletries were yummy smelling. the bed was very comfortable. we had a very long drink/dinner at The Grange, the restaurant in the hotel, and this made the stay great. The service was amazing, the drinks were made to flavor-profile requests, and the food was very tasty. We only stayed one night but it did seem like the cost was appropriate for the services/amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at The Citizen several times, it's so beautiful and the staff is friendly and knowledgable. The bell staff is ready with your bags, but if you prefer to carry your own, they never give an attitude. At the front desk, each person is helpful with directions to local places to go and will help with reservations when needed.
reviews.title: The Best in Sacramento
No complaints
reviews.text: Whether for a business trip or a romantic getaway, The Citizen is the perfect choice!

Excellent service all around for our short stay here. Restaurant is great as well. Will definitely stay her again on our next Sacramento trip. There was some nightlife noise on a Friday night, but nothing to complain about.
reviews.title: Uggggghhhhhh!
A beautiful, old hotel
reviews.text: First time I have ever been asked to wait 3 hours to check into my room. Seems like if ur not part of a wedding party they could care less about u! Never coming back again! Plus in the middle of skid row!

Stayed here on a business trip to Sacramento recently. The location of the hotel is in a mixed area. If you pull up front they will charge you $25 to valet your car overnight. If you drive half a block on the side of the park you can park overnight in a garage for $10. Check in was very easy and they were having a cocktail night in the Hotel Bar, so the the desk clerk was nice and gave me a room on the other side of the hotel with a nice view of the Capital Building. The hotel is politically oriented so that was nice for a change from the standard hotel. The lobby is filled with law books and the elevators have quotes from politicians in them. I forgot a tube of toothpaste and a gentleman brought up a complimentary tube within a minute. They have soft fluffy robes and the bed was amazing. There's also a number of nice restaurants within walking distance. It's good for a break from chain hotels, even thought it is a small chain of bouutique hotels of that makes sense. It has good character in an upscale way.
reviews.title: Would Definitely Stay Here Again

reviews.text: I just came back from sacramento where I stayed 2 nights at the citizen hotel. I had a delux king suite. I was not use to a boutique hotel, so maybe I was expecting too much, but coming from the east, i was a bit dissapointed in the lack of ammenities. The fact that everything cost was a bit discouraging as well. I never ate or had a meal there because of the prices. The size of the room was a issue as well. I went there to visit some friends and 3 normal size adults could not comfortably be in there to talk. I would stay there only if business is your agenda... If it's pleasure, this is not the spot.
reviews.title: Business only

reviews.text: What a Grear experience from the doorstep whereby the bellboys are literally constantly running as a standard to ensure the cars are brought from the car park great sense of urgency and service approach. The journey to the reception desk followed by the way ump to the room certainly emphasises the service culture within this hotel. The chairmanship suite WOW. Will certainly Ben back form more than the few hours I spent there.
reviews.title: Too short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent our wedding night here, and the staff at the Citizen could not have done a better job. We had the perfect room and excellent service. The ambience of the hotel itself is great, especially for a political nut like me. The food, both at the Grange and via room service, was delightful. Great stay. Best hotel in Sacramento, easily.
reviews.title: Fantastic atmosphere and stellar service

reviews.text: Modern comfort with a classic touch. My daughter was intrigued by the chess board in the lobby/library and started to play chess. Very comfortable rooms. Short walk from the capital building. The top hotel in Sacramento.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in an historical building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel. We stayed for 1 night on our way to Lake Tahoe. The staff were very welcoming. Our room was lovely with lots of character, great views and a decent coffee machine! The location was very convenient for walking round the centre of Sacramento. The town itself was very quiet, maybe because we stayed on a Sunday night.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travel pretty frequently and I feel like this was our best hotel experience in three or four years. From the staff, to the decor to the bathroom toiletries, everything was just wonderful. I can easily see why there were five weddings happening there over our 48-hour stay! The quality easily stands up to places like San Francisco's Mark Hopkins and at 1/3 of the price. I'd recommend the Citizen to anyone visiting Sacramento. I cannot think of a single negative thing to say about our stay there.
reviews.title: Delightful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He says: We stayed at The Citizen on the last night of our California vacation this week. I am so glad we did. The hotel was beautiful from lobby to 14th floor. Very fast parking and check-in. Every member of the staff was very polite and professional. Weary from our travels we decided on having dinner in our room. The steak was the best I had on the trip. The hotel sent complimentary champagne to our room after finding out it was our anniversary. Every time we spoke with a staff member they told us Happy Anniversary or Congrats and asked if we needed anything at all to make our stay more enjoyable. The room was wonderful. The view from the 14th floor is great. The spa tub and big comfy bed was a good way to prep for a day of sitting in an airplane. Hats off the The Citizen and it's staff!
reviews.title: Everything we wanted in a hotel! Loved it!

reviews.text: She says: TBA
reviews.title: Classy hotel in the heart of Sacramento

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night on a business trip. This hotel was very nicely decorated and the location was great. I booked a King Jnr suite for a good price through Expedia and was not disappointed. The room was large and beautifully furnished, with lovely views out of several windows. There was a desk and a couple of nice chairs, as well as a decent size wardrobe and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was lovely but the nice big shower head was not compatible with the wooden Venetian blinds which weren't recessed into the bathroom window. This meant they got saturated when I had a shower and they must have been a pain to clean and dry for the housekeepers. It just felt like a weird set up in a shower but certainly wasn't a total downer for my stay. The restaurant was lovely and I had a huge serve of pancakes for brekky. Valet parking was a reasonable option but street parking was okay for overnight without any cost. Just be aware of feeding the meter in the morning - was about $1 odd for an hour right near the hotel.
reviews.title: Downtown Sacramento Find
